byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Aurelien Breeden, Lilia Blaise and Elian Peltier from Paris; Raphael Minder from Madrid; and Helene Cooper and Michael D. Shear from Washington.

abstract: American tourists Spencer Stone, Alek Skarlatos and Anthony Sadler attack and subdue heavily armed man on high-speed European train in France; although some are wounded in confrontation, intervention saves passenger lives; Moroccan suspect, whose name is not released is known to Spanish authorities as member of radical Islam movement.
lead_paragraph: The quick action by two servicemen on a high-speed train traveling from Amsterdam to Paris averted what officials said could have been a blood bath.

headline.main: A Shot, a Glimpse of an AK-47, and U.S. Servicemen Pounced on Gunman on Train to France
headline.print_headline: An AK-47, Bullets Fly, Then Americans Pounce

snippet: The quick action by two servicemen on a high-speed train traveling from Amsterdam to Paris averted what officials said could have been a blood bath.
